info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 5:37PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Fulton, northwestern Saratoga and east central Montgomery Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 537 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Broadalbin, or near Gloversville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Gloversville, Corinth, Broadalbin, Edinburg, Mayfield, Fort Johnson, Cranberry Creek, Northampton Beach Public Campground, Kings, Mount Pleasant, Perth, Berkshire, West Perth, Munsonville, Shaw Corners, Church Corners, Barkersville, Glenwild, Wiley Corners and Conklingville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized poor drainage flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern and east central New York.
